prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Triangular Cutout** The first part of the CAD model is a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces. This part will serve as the base for subsequent parts. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0938, 0.0] Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. The sketch consists of the following faces: - Face 1: The main face of the rectangular prism with the triangular cutout. The sketch on Face 1 has the following loops and curves: - Loop 1: The perimeter of the rectangular prism with the triangular cutout. * Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.5625, 0.0] * Line 2: [0.5625, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.1875] * Line 3: [0.75, 0.1875] to [0.6094, 0.3281] * Line 4: [0.6094, 0.3281] to [0.4688, 0.1875] * Line 5: [0.4688, 0.1875] to [0.3281, 0.3281] * Line 6: [0.3281, 0.3281] to [0.0, 0.3281] * Line 7: [0.0, 0.3281] to [0.0, 0.0] Each curve is defined by its start and end points. To complete this part, we need to extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0938 units. Additionally, apply a scale transformation to the sketch using a factor of 0.75 prior to the extrusion operation. The final dimensions of this part are as follows: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.0938 units - Height: 0.75 units After completing this part, continue on to building the next part of the CAD model. Remember to consider each new part in the context of the overall CAD model.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0938,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.5625,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.5625,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.1875]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.1875],"End Point":[0.6094,0.3281]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.6094,0.3281],"End Point":[0.4688,0.1875]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.4688,0.1875],"End Point":[0.3281,0.3281]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.3281,0.3281],"End Point":[0.0,0.3281]},"line_7":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.3281],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0938,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole Part 1: Base of the Prism Construct a rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the location specified in the JSON data. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane with four lines forming a rectangle. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.4009. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch. Extrude the sketch by 0.0134 units towards the positive Z-axis to generate the 3D model. Part 2: Cylindrical Hole Construct a cylindrical hole in the prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the specified location. Draw a 2D sketch with three faces: 1. Face 1: Draw a circle on the X-Y plane with radius 0.0641. 2. Face 2: Draw the top face as a square with four lines, each having a length of 0.0895. Ensure they are parallel to the X and Y axes. 3. Face 3: Draw the bottom face as a square with four lines, each having a length of 0.0388. Ensure they are parallel to the X and Y axes. Connect these faces in a clockwise direction. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.3154. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch. Extrude the sketch by 0.0428 units towards the positive Z-axis, joining it with the base prism. Part 3: Cylindrical Top Construct the top cylinder. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the specified location. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane with two circles, one with a radius of 0.0802, and the other with a radius of 0.0641. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1604. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch. Extrude the sketch by 0.0214 units towards the negative Z-axis, joining it with the base prism. Part 4: Cutout Cylinder Construct the cutout cylinder. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the specified location. This part shares the same drawing as Part 3. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch and extrude the sketch by 0.1123 units towards the negative Z-axis, removing it from the base prism. Part 5: Top Prism Construct the rectangular top prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the specified location. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane with four lines forming a rectangle. Draw additional lines and faces along the Z-axis to create a 45-degree angled face. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.2219. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch. Extrude the sketch by 0.0053 units towards the positive Z-axis, joining it with the top cylinder. This new shape will form the complete assembly.</description>
